pull.title: Docs: Add disable-wallet section to OSX build instructions, update line in Unix instructions
pull.body: The `disable-wallet` section was mentioned in the `Berkeley DB` section of the OSX build instructions, but the section did not actually exist. This PR ports the section from the Unix build instructions.

events.message: Docs: Add disable-wallet section to OSX build instructions
Remove reference to deprecated RPC call in build instructions

rename.from: Docs: Add disable-wallet section to OSX build instructions
rename.to: Docs: Add disable-wallet section to OSX build instructions, update line in Unix instructions

events.body:
utACK a6f16f1, although longer term I prefer @MarcoFalke's:
> maybe a doc shared across all os that describes the configure options could make sense.

`getwork` was indeed removed in [0.10](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/release-notes/release-notes-0.10.0.md)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -64,6 +64,18 @@ Build Bitcoin Core
 
         make deploy
 
+Disable-wallet mode
+--------------------
+When the intention is to run only a P2P node without a wallet, Bitcoin Core may be compiled in
+disable-wallet mode with:
+
+    ./configure --disable-wallet
+
+In this case there is no dependency on Berkeley DB 4.8.
+
+Mining is also possible in disable-wallet mode, but only using the `getblocktemplate` RPC
+call not `getwork`.
comments.body: I doubt that such an option even exists: I get `unknown command: getwork`

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -64,6 +64,18 @@ Build Bitcoin Core
 
         make deploy
 
+Disable-wallet mode
+--------------------
+When the intention is to run only a P2P node without a wallet, Bitcoin Core may be compiled in
+disable-wallet mode with:
+
+    ./configure --disable-wallet
+
+In this case there is no dependency on Berkeley DB 4.8.
+
+Mining is also possible in disable-wallet mode, but only using the `getblocktemplate` RPC
+call not `getwork`.
comments.body:
Should I add a commit to update that line in both the Unix and OSX build instructions to the following?

```
Mining is also possible in disable-wallet mode using the `getblocktemplate` RPC call.
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -64,6 +64,18 @@ Build Bitcoin Core
 
         make deploy
 
+Disable-wallet mode
+--------------------
+When the intention is to run only a P2P node without a wallet, Bitcoin Core may be compiled in
+disable-wallet mode with:
+
+    ./configure --disable-wallet
+
+In this case there is no dependency on Berkeley DB 4.8.
+
+Mining is also possible in disable-wallet mode, but only using the `getblocktemplate` RPC
+call not `getwork`.
comments.body:
Right, could make sense to remove it in build-unix.md as well.

Though, shouldn't the configure options be independent of operating system? So maybe a doc shared across all os that describes the configure options could make sense. (no strong opinion on this)

comments.body: I noticed every operating system has a very difficult structure and format for its build instructions. It would be nice to see that more standardized. In this instance, I had been specifically building on OSX, which made me notice the missing section. I'll make that commit and update the PR title for now.
